name: Jay Leno
monologue: In Afghanistan, President Hamid Karzai is mad at the United States. We said his government is riddled with bribes, corruption, and pay-offs. I guess they’re trying to pass healthcare over there too.

name: Jay Leno
monologue: According to the Pentagon, al-Qaida has been so weakened financially that they’re turning to crimes like drugs, prostitution, and adjustable-rate mortgages.

name: Jay Leno
monologue: An Irish airline has announced that it will charge $1.50 to use the toilet on the airplane. A lot of people will find a whole new use for the airsick bag.

name: Jay Leno
monologue: In South Africa, a 96-year-old man has become the world’s oldest bungee jumper. The funeral will be this Tuesday.

name: Jimmy Fallon
monologue: A man in Pennsylvania was arrested for leaving marijuana in his son’s Elmo backpack. The cops became suspicious when Elmo laughed for two hours without being tickled.

name: Jimmy Fallon
monologue: Happy Birthday to Hugh Hefner, he turned 84 today. He must be the toughest person to buy a gift for. I mean what do you get for the guy who’s had everyone?

name: Jimmy Fallon
monologue: A Bank of America employee in North Carolina was arrested for installing a program on ATM machines so he could steal thousands of dollars. If convicted, the man faces a sentence of 20 years, 40 years, 60 years, or “other amount.”

name: Jimmy Fallon
monologue: A man from Thailand spent three extra years in an Indonesian prison because of a typo. It turns out he only roped a cow.
